evidence.source_document: Order Granting Plaintiffs’ Motion for Preliminary Injunction
evidence.text: ● from denying Special Immigrant Juvenile Status pursuant to 8 U.S.C. §1101(a)(27)(J)

extracted.value: enjoined and restrained from denying Special Immigrant Juvenile Status pursuant to 8 U.S.C. §1101(a)(27)(J)

evidence.source_document: Order Granting Plaintiffs’ Motion for Class Certification
evidence.text:
It is, accordingly, hereby ORDERED, ADJUDGED AND DECREED:
1.  This action shall be maintained as a class action under Fed. R. Civ. P. 23(b)(3)

extracted.value: This action shall be maintained as a class action under Fed. R. Civ. P. 23(b)(3)

evidence.source_document: Order Granting Plaintiffs’ Motion for Preliminary Injunction
evidence.text: USCIS shall, within thirty days of the date of this Order, reopen and readjudicate any Special Immigrant Juvenile Status petition that was denied on the grounds that the Washington state court did not have jurisdiction or authority to 'reunify' an immigrant with his or her parents.

extracted.value: USCIS shall, within thirty days of the date of this Order, reopen and readjudicate any Special Immigrant Juvenile Status petition that was denied on the grounds that the Washington state court did not have jurisdiction or authority to 'reunify' an immigrant with his or her parents.

evidence.source_document: Order Granting Plaintiffs’ Motion for Preliminary Injunction
evidence.text: USCIS is also ORDERED to adjudicate all outstanding Special Immigrant Juvenile Status petitions based on a Washington state court order within thirty days of the date of this Order if more than 150 days have already passed since the petition was filed. All other Special Immigrant Juvenile Status petitions based on Washington state court orders shall be adjudicated within the 180-day period set forth.

extracted.value: USCIS is also ORDERED to adjudicate all outstanding Special Immigrant Juvenile Status petitions based on a Washington state court order within thirty days of the date of this Order if more than 150 days have already passed since the petition was filed; and all other Special Immigrant Juvenile Status petitions based on Washington state court orders shall be adjudicated within the 180-day period set forth.

evidence.source_document: Order Granting Plaintiffs’ Motion for Preliminary Injunction
evidence.text: Defendants and their officers, agents, employees, representatives, and all persons acting in concert or participating with them are ENJOINED AND RESTRAINED from denying Special Immigrant Juvenile Status pursuant to 8 U.S.C. §1101(a)(27)(J) on the ground that a Washington state court did not have jurisdiction or authority to 'reunify' an immigrant with his or her parents.

extracted.value: Defendants and their officers, agents, employees, representatives, and all persons acting in concert or participating with them are ENJOINED AND RESTRAINED from denying Special Immigrant Juvenile Status pursuant to 8 U.S.C. §1101(a)(27)(J) on the ground that a Washington state court did not have jurisdiction or authority to 'reunify' an immigrant with his or her parents.

evidence.source_document: Order Granting Plaintiffs’ Motion for Preliminary Injunction
evidence.text: Defendants and their officers, agents, employees, representatives, and all persons acting in concert or participating with them are ENJOINED AND RESTRAINED from initiating removal proceedings against or removing any SIJ petitioner whose SIJ petition has been denied on the ground that the Washington state court did not have jurisdiction or authority to 'reunify' an immigrant with his or her parents.

extracted.value: Defendants and their officers, agents, employees, representatives, and all persons acting in concert or participating with them are ENJOINED AND RESTRAINED from initiating removal proceedings against or removing any SIJ petitioner whose SIJ petition has been denied on the ground that the Washington state court did not have jurisdiction or authority to 'reunify' an immigrant with his or her parents.

evidence.source_document: Order Granting Plaintiffs’ Motion for Class Certification
evidence.text: This action shall be maintained as a class action under Fed. R. Civ. P. 23(b)(3)

extracted.value: This action shall be maintained as a class action under Fed. R. Civ. P. 23(b)(3).

evidence.source_document: Order Granting Plaintiffs’ Motion for Class Certification
Order Granting Plaintiffs’ Motion for Class Certification
evidence.text: Plaintiffs’ counsel are hereby appointed and designated as counsel for the above‑mentioned class and are authorized to act on behalf of the members of the classes.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs’ counsel are hereby appointed and designated as counsel for the above‑mentioned class and are authorized to act on behalf of the members of the classes.

evidence.source_document: Order Granting Joint Motion for Final Approval of Settlement Agreement
evidence.text: "The Agreement provides that Defendants shall pay Plaintiffs the amount of $400,000 in costs are reasonable."

extracted.value: Defendants shall pay Plaintiffs the amount of $400,000 in costs.

evidence.source_document: Order Granting Joint Motion for Final Approval of Settlement Agreement
evidence.text: "3. The Court shall retain jurisdiction over all disputes between and among the Parties arising out of the Agreement, including but not limited to interpretation and enforcement of the terms of the Agreement, exceptasprovided in the Agreementand pursuant to the terms of the Agreement."

extracted.value: The Court shall retain jurisdiction over all disputes between and among the Parties arising out of the Agreement, including but not limited to interpretation and enforcement of the terms of the Agreement, except as provided in the Agreement and pursuant to the terms of the Agreement.

evidence.source_document: Order Granting Joint Motion for Final Approval of Settlement Agreement
evidence.text: "The settlement of the Motion pursuant to the terms and conditions of the Settlement Agreement is hereby approved pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 23(e) and shall be binding on all parties to the Settlement Agreement:"

extracted.value: The settlement of the Motion pursuant to the terms and conditions of the Settlement Agreement is hereby approved pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 23(e) and shall be binding on all parties to the Settlement Agreement.

evidence.source_document: Order Granting Joint Motion for Final Approval of Settlement Agreement
evidence.text: "1. The Agreement is hereby incorporated by reference in this Order, and all terms or phrases used in this Order shall have the same meaning as in the Agreement."

extracted.value: The Agreement is hereby incorporated by reference in this Order, and all terms or phrases used in this Order shall have the same meaning as in the Agreement.
